parts.statement: Who or what did Lencho have faith in? What did he do?
parts.explanation: Lencho had firm faith in God. When his crop was destroyed by hailstorm, he wrote a letter to God asking for one hundred pesos to sow his field again.

parts.statement: What two national anthems were sung?
parts.explanation: The national anthem of the old South Africa and the new South Africa were sung.

parts.statement: Why were two national anthems sung?
parts.explanation: Two national anthems were sung to show unity between the whites and blacks of South Africa after the end of apartheid.

parts.statement: What compelled the young seagull to take his first flight?
parts.explanation: The young seagull was compelled by hunger when his mother tempted him with a piece of fish.

parts.statement: What is the Chinese legend about tea?
parts.explanation: According to the Chinese legend, tea was discovered accidentally when tea leaves fell into boiling water.

parts.statement: Why did Valli react to the dead cow?
parts.explanation: Valli was deeply shocked to see the dead cow because it reminded her of her own loneliness and mortality.

parts.statement: Why did Siddhartha Gautama abandon luxurious life?
parts.explanation: He abandoned luxurious life to find the truth of human suffering.

parts.statement: Where did Siddhartha Gautama get enlightenment?
parts.explanation: He got enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree at Bodh Gaya.

questions.text: Answer the following questions in about 30 words: (any two)

parts.statement: In reference of the poem ‘Fire and Ice’, how will the world end?
parts.explanation: According to the poet, the world may end either in fire caused by desire or in ice caused by hatred.

parts.statement: What are the things that Amanda’s mother asks her to do and not to do?
parts.explanation: Amanda’s mother asks her to sit straight, clean her room, finish homework, and not eat chocolates.

parts.statement: What will the departure of the trees affect the house?
parts.explanation: The house will collapse because trees provide support and protection.

questions.text: Answer the following questions in about 30 words: (any two)

parts.statement: How did the narrator cure Tricki?
parts.explanation: The narrator cured Tricki by stopping rich food and giving him exercise and discipline.

parts.statement: How did Ausable get rid of Max?
parts.explanation: Ausable frightened Max by creating a fake story of a balcony, forcing him to jump out of the window.

parts.statement: How did Griffin become invisible?
parts.explanation: Griffin became invisible by discovering a scientific formula to change the refractive index of his body.

questions.text: How did Valli plan her bus ride? What did she find out about the bus, and how did she save up the fare?

parts.statement: Answer
parts.explanation: Valli planned her bus ride by carefully observing the bus timings and fare. She saved money by avoiding unnecessary expenses and collecting coins.

parts.statement: What does the young boy say to Anne Gregory?
parts.explanation: The young boy tells Anne Gregory that her inner beauty matters more than her outward appearance.

parts.statement: Why did Custard cry for a nice safe cage? Why is the dragon called ‘cowardly dragon’?
parts.explanation: Custard wanted safety and was called cowardly because he always feared danger, though he later proved brave.
